reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General reports every 90 days, specifically requests a written report no later than 15 April 2016
summary:
12. Requests UNISFA to continue dialogue with AJOC and communities on ensuring compliance with Abyei's status.

13. Urges confidence-building measures among communities in the Abyei Area.

14. Welcomes UNISFA initiatives to support community dialogue and reconciliation.
Here is a concise summary of the Security Council document:

16. Welcomes UNISFA's efforts to strengthen Community Protection Committees in Abyei to manage law and order, in coordination with Misseriya and Ngok Dinka communities.

17. Calls for cooperation with the Abyei Area Joint Investigation and Inquiry Committee's findings and recommendations on the killing of a UNISFA peacekeeper and Ngok Dinka Paramount Chief.

18. Intends to review UNISFA's mandate for possible reconfiguration based on Sudan and South Sudan's compliance with previous decisions.

19. Calls on Member States to ensure free and unhindered movement of UNISFA personnel, equipment, and supplies.

20. Urges Sudan and South Sudan to provide full support to the UN, including visas, basing arrangements, and logistical support.

21. Recognizes the need for development projects and basic government services in Abyei and calls for support from Sudan, South Sudan, and donors.

22. Demands Sudan and South Sudan facilitate UNMAS deployment to clear mines in Abyei and SDBZ.

23. Demands all parties allow humanitarian personnel full access to civilians in need.

24. Urges all parties to cease violence, human rights violations, and abuses.

25. Requests the Secretary-General to ensure human rights monitoring and report to the Council.

26. Requests the Secretary-General to ensure UNISFA complies with the UN's zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse.

27. Requests a written report from the Secretary-General on UNISFA's progress by April 15, 2016.

28. Notes cooperation among UN missions in the region and requests continued cooperation.

29. Decides to remain seized of this matter.
